item.title: The U.S. added just 64,000 jobs in November -- a sign the labor market is slowing
item.description: Hiring cooled this fall, according to delayed figures released by the Labor Department Tuesday. Employers added 64,000 jobs in November as the unemployment rate rose to 4.6%.

item.title: Chain restaurants are hit by tariffs and inflation. How do they control costs?
item.description: Inflation, rising food prices and the high cost of living have been top of mind for consumers all year. But then Olive Garden offers an unlimited pasta meal, or a chain steakhouse restaurant sells a steak dinner with two sides for less than 30 bucks. So, how are chains able to keep prices as low as they do in this economy?

item.title: 'Catastrophe bonds' are gaining popularity as a response to climate change
item.description: After the hurricane in Jamaica, the government had a pot of money to help rebuild. A Catastrophe Bonds payout. We explain how it works and why Cat Bond popularity is on the rise as a response to climate change.

item.title: Farmers welcome Trump's $12 billion aid package, say additional relief is needed
item.description: President Trump says he's sending $12 billion in aid to American farmers who are reeling from global trade disruptions. Those include inflation and Trump's tariffs that are making fertilizer and farm equipment more expensive, and the President's trade war with China which closed a huge market for American soybean exports.

item.title: Federal Reserve votes to cut interest rates for a 3rd time
item.description: The Federal Reserve voted to cut interest rates Wednesday by another quarter percent, in an effort to prop up a sagging job market. Fed officials warned they'll be cautious about more cuts in 2026.
